intro: Oenothera hirta var. ignota, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening and close by morning. The plant has hairy, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Oenothera hirta var. ignota is a member of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators such as moths and bats.
